"The Whale in the Pond" is's first book. It tells the story of a young boy named Sammy who goes on an adventure to find a lost treasure in his town. Along the way, he meets a friendly whale named Whaley who helps him navigate the pond and solve puzzles to find the treasure.

"The Whale in the Pond" is a sequel to "The Little Mermaid". It follows the journey of Ariel and Flounder as they search for a new home after their underwater kingdom is destroyed by a giant storm. Along the way, they encounter a wise old whale who teaches them about the importance of community and friendship.

"The Whale in the Pond" is a fable about the dangers of greed. It tells the story of a greedy little fish who becomes obsessed with a shiny rock in the pond. He spends all his time chasing after the rock, ignoring his friends and his surroundings. Eventually, he realizes the error of his ways and learns to value his relationships over material possessions.

"The Whale in the Pond" is a story about the power of imagination. It follows the journey of a young girl named who is afraid of the dark. One night, she falls asleep by the pond and dreams of a magical whale who shows her the beauty of the night sky. From that day on, she is no longer afraid of the dark and learns to embrace her imagination.

"The Whale in the Pond" is a science fiction story set in a future where the Earth is covered in water. It tells the story of a group of humans who are stranded on a deserted island after a massive flood. They discover a mysterious whale who has the power to control the tides and use it to help them survive. Along the way, they learn about the importance of cooperation and resourcefulness in the face of adversity.
